Large place, lots of seating at booths or tables (seat yourself) clean, dark and casual. Sparsely decorated with no real theme or atmosphere and a couple of TVs playing quietly. You order at the counter and they bring it to your table. Meats come un-sauced and they have three or four different sauces at a central counter you help yourself to. Crowd was sparse and a mix of suits and uniforms  service was friendly and competent and they explained how to order since it was our first time. 

My lunch mate had the pulled pork sandwich which is simply meat in a bun and a side of green chili Mac and cheese. 

I had a two meat combo with brisket and tri-tip and the Mac on the side and ordered a slice of the gooey butter cake for us to share. Combo comes with Texas toast. 

Pulled pork was excellent, smoky and well cooked. The brisket and tri-tip were ok, not horrible, not memorable and all my food, including the toast, was room temperature and dry. Mac and cheese are individual (not suitable for sharing as an FYI) a la carte portions and was tasty and heated through. Drinks are also self service and the ice tea was fresh and it appears they have beer, wine and cocktails. My lunchmate noted that the choices are "white" and "red" and are $9 a glass, cocktails are $7 and beers are $5, going on memory. 

Combined this very simple meal was about $35.00+ and frankly for that much was not comparable to what you'd get for the same money at many other places in the area, for instance at OSHO a short distance away that serves really great hit and juicy pulled pork, brisket and pastrami sandwiches with good sides in a slightly nicer environment, or for that matter Hillstones at the Biltmore, where we could have eaten for a comparable cost.

Great food in a small, loud restaurant and bar populated by neighborhood cougars and the men that love them, at least while they are there. As with any great steakhouse the side dishes  are the standout, at least for me (mac and cheese, spinach, mushrooms, whipped mashed potatoes etc) . Their seafood actually impressed more than the (very good) steaks and I've had halibut, tuna and the seafood tower there, all above average in quality, taste and value.  Heavy  wine list and strong cocktails lead to boisterous crowds. Severs are well trained and uniformly friendly based on at least 5 visits there. I'd go here over most comparable places in town, and PHX/Scottsdale has many high end steak places.

One of the better Asian buffets in the PHX Scottsdale area. They have a dozen plus varieties of freshly made sushi rolls, tempura, egg and spring rolls, a raw bar with shrimp, oysters and crab legs, some dim sum favorites and at least 20 hot Chinese entrees in addition to a massive desert bar, salads, fresh fruit and a Mongolian BBQ type raw fresh grill where you pick your meats and veggies and the chef stir fries it  for you while you wait. Everything is typically fresh and they keep the dishes full. Easy place to take a bunch of folks who all have different tastes and want something different because there's something for everybody even kids. It's a hell of a deal for 15 bucks at lunch. They charge more for dinner and throw in some extra items like prime rib. One interesting detail, it looks like a claim jumper restaurant inside because it used to be one. Antler chandeliers and all. Not quite as good as what you might find in LA or San Francisco but head and shoulders above most Asian buffets in Phoenix which tend to be nightmares of deep-fried meat, sweet-and-sour sauce and greasy noodles.

Very poor service, said they were too busy to even make us tea or take an order. Walked out unserved, there was only one other table. If you can't both fill a catering order and serve people, lock the door.

As a tribute to native son Andy Warhol the museum serves as a historical survey as well as a venue to display his art. Most interesting was the Victoria Museum's show comparing and contrasting Warhol's art and that of Ai WeiWei. How each artist uses similar themes to express different ideas was interesting and enlightening.

On a short visit to Pittsburgh we made a reservation at Altius to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We wanted to pick a special spot with atmosphere and the description of Altius filled the bill. Needless to say the view was spectacular and the fireworks after the Steelers game made it more so. The service was superb. We had the charcuterie and the Chinese duck bao as starters each of which was wonderful. We split the special aged rib steak which was seasoned and cooked to perfection. The dessert was the panacotta with mango which was as beautiful as it was delicious. All in all it was a wonderful way to celebrate our special day.

Having grown up in a typical Philly neighborhood I felt right at home at Deluca's. The street and the restaurant transported me back to my childhood. The food line, the counter stools, the friendly wait staff all made the experience special. My wife and I stuck with the usual breakfast fare.  French toast, eggs and bacon, hash browns, toast and coffee. Everything fresh and familiar. Living close to Baltimore it is a pity they could not save some of the old close-in shopping areas to create a draw such as the Strip.

Overall visit was good, but it could have been better. Check in had a long line, but it moved relatively quickly. Hotel is super quiet, so you will not have to worry about club noise or crazy neighbors. Had a few issues with my room. Not sure who or why anyone would want to mess up a hotel room, but furniture and walls were clearly damaged and never repaired. My tv remote was useless and took a ton of button presses before it did anything. Someone also decided to completely destroy the remote screen by the bed before my visit. It looked like someone pressed so hard on the screen that it destroyed the pixels and made it virtually useless. Took two calls to the front desk before these were finally exchanged. I was offered another room but on the 3rd floor? No thank you. Pretty sure there were plumbing issues in my room. Sink and tub drains were extremely loud, and toilet even flushed once on its own. One of the sink handles in the room was also broken. Get it together Aria!

This place is a hole in the wall good hotel. I've never had a problem in the many years I've gone here growing up. Every year I stay here with my family. The service is great and so are the hotel rooms. They have remodeled the rooms so they look a lot better. It's a tee bit away from the strip but not a big deal. Rooms at under $50 a night....can't complain.

This is my review for this restaurant on Google Maps. And unless they have changed their name recently, the correct name is Everest Hakka House.

This is an update to my last review. not 5 stars anymore. They recently cut their portions down by 25% and put the price up 1 to 4$ per dish. Not such a good deal now. Customer Service here sucks when you have a complaint, they just don't really care. Hence the reason for this review update. Recently they have messed up my order twice and have offered me a free dinner. When I went in to claim my free dinner, it was not in the system. This place is falling apart! I don't recommend it to anyone, anymore.
Excellent place to eat. They did have to close but they have since reopened. 6.95 everything on the menu. Excellent food. Good atmosphere.

Can't get enough of The Bodega. We work right around the corner so it's convenient and SO delicious. The tuna melt with Pimento is off da chain and today I had the Gmans Gwich for the first time and it may just be the best sandwich i've ever had. My favorite deli in Charlotte, for sure!

Worst fedex location. The two people that we're working were absolutely rude. Didn't acknowledge that I needed help. When I was leaving the store, one of the employees asked didn't you need a box? (With a rude tone) I would not recommend going to this location

I'm always absolutely in love with my eyebrows, since the first time, and every time I get a touch up. I religiously book appointments with Trudy every six months to keep them looking amazing. That might be overkill, but having perfect eyebrows, and NEVER filling them in, is a good enough reason for me. Trudy is amazing at what she does and I've never been disappointed. My brows are seriously perfect. She's very truthful  about the healing process and your skin type and how she thinks they'll heal. Everyones skin heals differently. After my first appointment the strokes had faded a bit and some disappeared, but after my touch up they were perfect. Her IG pictures depicting the shapes of different brows and the results are highly truthful and accurate.

Also if you're aware of her IG then you should be well aware of her following and the demand that brings for the amount of clients she has. If you expect an email back ten minutes after you send it, then that's your problem. And if you expect an appointment within a week, then that's also your misguided judgement. She's in high demand and like any quality high demand professional, bookings need to be made far in advance. Don't leave from your appointment with Trudy and not rebook your next one. If something comes up where you need to reschedule last minute, you're going to be booking months down the road again. No matter what I'm doing in the future, I make sure I'm available for my appointment; it's a priority for me especially knowing how in demand she is. 

I also always make sure to text her a few days in  advance to confirm and double check the appointment and her address. I've never had an issue.

She's wonderful to talk to during the appointment. Super kind, professional and considerate. Be aware and considerate of her policies and book your appointments in advance and there's no issues.

I love the store!!! Lots of great crystals & great staff. Maria help me understand how some crystals work & how I can use them on my everyday life style. This is my new favorite store  Maria went out of her way to help me find the best crystal that fit my needs. Thank you so much for your help and time.

Dr Cozine has been our family dentist  for over 15 years. He is an amazing human being and a very skilled professional. His office is modern, immaculate and efficient . He is caring and a true professional. Appointments run on time and he does not do any procedures unless absolutely necessary for your health. We send all our friends & clients to him and they love his office & staff. Give Dr Cozine a try , you will be glad you did.

The owner of Advantage landscape came out and spoke with my husband about our plans to utilize the SNWA for grass removal and desert landscape.  We found him to be very concerned about taking care of our needs.  We are in the process of working on new plans with one of his associates and hoping to proceed as soon as our HOA approves the pavestones and we can get that done.
Edgar is a true professional and did a great job . Will enjoy using his services in the future.

Another great job today trimming palms & removing a sick plum tree. The crew is efficient, professional and shows up when they say! They do book up in advance so I'm going to book for next year soon :)

Steve is exceptional and have used his services for quite a long time. He is a very busy guy , runs his business , like a business and shows up on time . We refer him to our friends and clients and they are pleased. He is a trustworthy individual and is creative & skilled to be able to fix challenging problems , right the first time! You will be glad you called him first .
Have been with Toni's pet sitters for many years and she is particular on how she does business and makes sure her staff is efficient and qualified to take care of your pet family.

They just finished a long front walk-way and steps today.  The crew is professional, shows up on time and does a great job!  Very professional and went the extra mile to make us happy.  We are very glad we chose this Company!
Great staff, great food. Best noodles we've had in a very long time and the chicken wings are
Excellent food, fun atmosphere and good service. This is a must try if you like Asian fusion!

I was looking forward to Shane's tonight. This location is training a new chef, however, and the chicken is overcooked and tough...that's the only reason for my less than great review this time.  Hopefully the next visit will be better!

A great place to have a drink with friends.
Food is mediocre but I don't hold that against them
The Kiss Pinball machine is fun and they have a great patio

I really like this place.  I stick with the curries and the Rama.  It is one of my staples.  I am glad it is getting better known.  I have been to several Thai places--but I like this one the best.

All of those I have introduced this place to have liked it as well.

This place was great. Super good service. Modern environment. Easy access. The prices were fair. Some of the best Indian cuisine we have eaten.  (There were chicken nuggets for the kids). 

There are three Indian restaurants in a row. We are glad we landed here. If we lived here, we would definitely work it into our foodie rotation.
Love this place.  The only problem is I have a hard time choose which meal to order.  It is a staple.

Just found this place. One in Tempe near Mill. One in Mesa near the fiesta Mall. 

Fantastic!  I have only been twice--in the last two days.  They make their own bread (Dutch crunch).  There are about 500 options.  The onion rings are great. 

Good prices. About $10.  Great food.   And they top it off with a free Carmel covered apple sucker.  Nice!

I will update with upcoming visits.  Can't wait!

If I had to choose between all Mexican Restaurants, I would choose this place.  It is, to me, the most authentic.  The staples are great: fried beef/chicken tacos; red enchiladas; rolled tacos; steak/chicken burros. The rice/beans at this place are the all time best.  For my taste, the salsas are just OK. I wish the food was more spicy. But this is a general problem north of the boarder. 

Try it. Love it. 

Note: I have only been posting about places I really like.  No sense wasting time on places I don't like.

We usually avoid food places on the tourist strips.  But we are glad we stopped here. The pizza as wonderful. The spaghetti was perfect. The chicken salad was another hit. 

Easy access. Good service. Fairly priced for being on the Royal mile.

This was the first place we ate on our trip. It was close to our AB&B. 

We might have simply been hungry. But whatever the case, the food hit the spot. 

We had Steak & Ale pie; fish and chips; chicken salad; and a Burger. Everyone was happy. 

It was a pleasant atmosphere. The service was great. The prices good. The food was tasty.

i have been to so may nail salon, and i have to tell you, the owner does the best nails i have ever had. i don't live close, but i will go out of my way to go to him. they last for 3 weeks and beautiful every nail is perfect! even if they speak in vietnameise, i don't care, the price is right and my nails look great!
i have been going to VCA Mountain View Animal Hospital since the early 2000's. Doctor walker and his staff are the best caring vets i have ever had the pleasure to meet and take care of my pets!

horrible! waste of 375.00. she talked the hole time about herself and her problems. did not listen to how "I" wanted them done! they are not solid one is longer than the other and very thin! this was in two sittings too! so very disappointing! feeling totally ripped off! never went back for the third sitting because she could not even come close to getting it right in two sittings!

Holy cats!! This was the best choice we made on our vacation!  The hamburger was fabulous with a fresh baked roll as the bun. The sweet potato fries were the best I have ever had anywhere. Service was great and this is a worthy stop!!

cousins brought me here. The sweet potato fries are ok not a fan of the place its a chain so things feel to corporate. The workers here felt like they were about to die and the sight of us made them smile for help. The food wasnt that good and over priced. The island feel... i dont get it, which islands? Caribbean or Pacific? its cool to play bob marley but make up your mind on the items.
My wife had the chicken boxty and I had the Shepard's pie. Both were wonderful and we would come back again for sure.  Service was good but I could see it slowing as they got busier. We will be back!

Well this is my first time at this location I read the reviews and they were kind of mixed so I decided to try it anyway needless to say I will not be back unfortunately I was stuck with getting Danny to do my pedicure and the pedicure itself was okay but it just wasn't as personable and relaxing as I normally have had in the past when it got to the painting time he kept trying to get me to get a French tip color that I did not want and I kept telling him I want cappuccino with a French tip he kept saying oh you need cotton candy and I kept having to say I do not want cotton candy after I found a color he painted my toes and I had to keep telling him are you going to fix that are you going to fix that I think I could have painted this better than what he did it was just not a very good  pedicure that I wanted. The only reason I gave it a 2-star is because the actual massage chair was the best thing about my visit hints if you do try going here don't go to Denny.

I can't say enough about the staff here.I was sad that Ajay left but after speaking with her grandmother who happens to be the manager Ms.Linda who is absolutely the gem of this establishment I understood her reasoning.I normally come in the mornings for my breakfast before heading to work,i have never had an incorrect order and I always get enough napkins which now seems to be hard to come by at fast food places.Its just a great start to my day when i see Ms.Linda and she is such a delight and joy to my start of my hectic days.

My friend from work have been raving and raving about this place and she always comes here after church so one night before we all hung out we was like let's all go to dinner so we suggest it Island flavor and oh my God out of the park I loved everything about it they gave you big portions of food it's very inexpensive the food is taste fresh it was just awesome way way way way way better than Aloha Kitchen I had the combination plate  and it was amazing. We will definitely make this our favorite food place.

So finally this place open we are regulars at the oyster bar at Palace Station we decided we needed to try this place because it's much closer to home and we were tired of the three-hour wait for Palace Station which is by the way very well worth it so we came to the oyster bar at Santa Fe Station we were seated and greeted by the manager I believe his name is John super cool dude love him he was awesome if it wasn't for him we would have left the restaurant we are seated at the bar it took about maybe 25 minutes before the server Corey who had horrible customer service to come and greet us. 2 people were seated next to us and their server gave them water gave them bread took their order before our server even came to ask us if we wanted anything to drink.We had to end up calling over John to find out what's going on with the server she was walking back and forth in front of us several times before she even took our orders or even made eye contact.We ordered the kitchen pan roast I believe with Lobster it was good the food was great awesome it's up there with the original Palace Station oyster bar but the customer service from Corey made my experience horrible. We had to ask Kory to refill our drinks and it took us like 3 or 4 times to get her attention she would not paying any attention we had to like kind of like I had her down to actually get her to see it and we're sitting at the bar to get her to fill our drinks when we got ready to go we needed to go bags she says oh I have other orders in front of you so just wait a minute when she bagged up our food she threw our bread away which is really good she threw the bread away I didn't have any bread to eat when I brought my food home. That's pretty much it luckily I love food so the experience was horrible but you know I'll give it another try because I do love the food there but Corey I hope you read this and really take note on your attitude

So I was really excited when I first saw this sign going up and they were building this because I am originally from California and I am a super huge fan of Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles so my fiance came and picked me up from work for lunch one day and he was like let's try this place can't go wrong with chicken and waffles. I was wrong it was not it was definitely not Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles the sides were very Bland and had no taste the chicken were big pieces which I was surprised about,the waffle was just okay it wasn't something to write home about the service did take forever but the server was super nice.The prices were a lot compared to other places I have been to..
What a great place to hangout with friends after drinks and gambling. This's my second trip to Las Vegas and always love to come here! The service is awesome and the food is great!!

Trying this place for the first time and didn't expect this place to be this good! The food was awesome!! I ordered chicken tikka masala and it's really delicious, it's not to overwhelming with the Indian spices, it's just the right amount of it. If I come back to Las Vegas, I'll definitely be back here again.

Please don't eat here!!! We were in Las Vegas for the first time and stayed at the Mandalay Bay and happened to try this buffet .... I was so surprised how lame the buffet was ... it's like an ordinary Chinese buffet; I'm sorry for saying that but I was really disappointed. Seriously don't eat here, with the same price you can get the best buffet at the Cosmopolitan.

Found this place while browsing in Las Vegas .... the food is awesome and very authentic!! A must try if you're by the Flamingo and Caesar Palace. The only reason I have 4 instead of 5 stars is that they don't have just beef by itself but beef with lamb.

Love love love!! Can't get enough of this store, the owner Taucha and the girls that work there are all fantastic! Talk about amazing selection of clothing, jewels, gifts and lots of laughs. They are so helpful, go above and beyond and always give an honest opinion about what I try on because they want to make sure I leave happy..which I always do! I recommend everyone I know to go there and shop, not only will you leave satisfied with your purchase it feels like you made new girlfriends by how comfortable the staff makes you feel. And their Instagram is also amazing, they post all of the new merchandise and if you aren't nearby and see something you like they will hold it for you or ship!!
I love this restaurant. The atmosphere is quaint and the food is excellent! My favorite date night spot in Chandler.

These rooms were awesome!! I have never felt so comfortable and welcomed at a Vegas hotel in the past 20 years of coming. The front desk concierge was super friendly and accommodating. The room was clean and we had an amazing view.
We look forward to coming back.
This place has made me a better artist all around.  The teachers are very informative and patient.
OH EMM GEEE!! This is the families favorite place to eat. The Swarma Tortilla is DEE -LISH so if you are confused on what to get...get that. Man.. now my mouth is watering. Nom Nom Nom.

I must say that this is the best dentist office that I have ever been to. I purchased a Groupon for Invisiline at almost half of what other offices were charging.  When you walk into the office it is nicely decorated and the staff is friendly.They also have coffee and water in the waiting area and a toothbrush with toothpaste just in case you forgot to brush your teeth before you came in. Definitely recommend!

Update: A few years ago, I moved two hours away from All About You. I often thought about making the drive to get botox and filler from Dawn as I never felt 100% comfortable with the injectors in my area. I finally moved back to closer to All About You and booked my appointment as soon as possible. In the time I was gone, All About You has moved locations and the new facility is beautiful! I was not disappointed by my long awaited visit back. I was greeted by Jordan at the front desk who was very helpful and sweet. Of course, Dawn did not disappoint with her flawless injections and awesome customer service. She is the only person I trust to do the job right. All About You is still living up to their name.

Ok so I have struggled with back pain for about 10 years now. I have tried everything and I must say, it has been about a month and my back pain has reduced about 95 percent since my cupping/massage treatment. For the first time in years, I can workout without my pain setting me back, I can sit and watch movies without the nagging of my sciatica. A must try if you struggle with chronic pain. Very nice customer service.

Just came back from a very disappointing breakfast.  We have dined here before and never had a problem.  This time was very different.  Not sure if under new management or cutting cost but will not come back.  The bacon was overcooked after telling the waitress we do not like it crispy, the hashbrowns were loaded with pepper, and twice we had to ask the waitress for more milk.  Too bad!  Use to enjoy coming here but will not again.

O.K. I think this is one of the best in the area.  I have eaten at a lot of Subways but this one in Westwood Town Center (by Marc's) is pretty decent.    Recently the boyfriend and I went here 4 dinner and there was a mix up with my sandwich and a to-go order who was busy playing with his phone and not paying attention.  The order was corrected with many apologies and I was given a $5 gift card as a refund.  They were still apologizing as I left.  I must say, that I have mix ups at other locations and I have never had it fixed so quickly,, or as politely as this location.  Others haven't even made an effort to fix a problem and this is why I drive to this one, and not walk to the one by my house.
I love this place. I live minutes from it and can always find a good deal.  I like that I get a few bucks for my magazines and that it is good for the planet.  Recycling at it's best!

This place has good food, but the decor is lacking and looks ever more down at heel every time I go.  Stay away from the salad bar as the soup is usually cold.  The breakfasts are good and the fries are good.  Little iffy on the staff some days, but a good place to go with a friend if you want to talk and not be rushed.

We use this one because it is right by the boyfriends house.  Not too bad most of the time.  Have had a few wing-nut help incidents, but not as bad as other review.  Most of the time, we have had no problems.  No dine in at this one,

The boyfriend and I tried this Sunday, 4/6/14.   We were there around noon,and we had the place to ourselves.  I went there because I wanted to scope it out before using a gift cert. I got from a reward program. I had the Buckeye, a house specialty that is supposed to have peanut-butter in it, and an Angel food muffin.  The boyfriend had a smoothie and a white chip/cranberry cookie.  

I could not eat my muffin and it was swiftly and promptly refunded with much apology.  It was tough, and had the texture of memory foam.   The boyfriends alleged smoothie was a mix from a box blended with ice as he requested dairy free.    His cookie was very hard and my coffee was just sweet, with no discernible peanut-butter flavor.   Some customers had left as we came in and their table went uncleared the entire time we sat there, which left me wondering why I kept smelling pickles, which we think was dressing in dishes on the plates.  The place was so empty that this was not acceptable.  I will think twice before returning to use my gift cert which requires spending $20 to save $!0.  

At $5 for a large coffee, shouldn't be too hard.
This is more like it!  We were here with party of 8 this past weekend and out food was hot, accurate and tasty!

Went here for the first time yesterday, 4/25/14 with the boyfriend for lunch.  I was given a gift card by a friend who camped out, and I have been wanting to go here ever since.   We went about 2 in the afternoon, which was a good time for first timers since we could take our time and figure out what we wanted.  Being used to and LOVING Chipotle, the system is similar therefore familiar, which helps.  I got a small pasta bowl with the "hot" Alfredo sauce.  It was accidentally knocked over, quickly restarted and with much heartfelt apology.   I had cheese (and lots of it :)  ) with artichokes.  The boyfriend had a chef style (meaning it was prepared the way it is on the menu) of calamari much to my grossness.  (I am NOT eating anything that can taste me back, is looking at me, or that could suction itself to me!  No thank you!  UGGH!)   We got Italian sodas and  the price is what we would have spent at Chipotle, so it is very affordable   The sauce was not as temperature hot as I would have liked, so the dish was cold in spots, but hey, it's pasta,s so it can be eaten cold, which I do frequently, so I was not upset.  The best part was the garlic piada that comes with the pasta or the salad.  It reminded me of Naan, which I LOVE and I love garlic naan, so already liking it.  IT'S FULL OF CHEESE!    I am an unabashed cheese freak (you can never have too much cheese or chocolate).  The artichokes were cleaned, grilled with nice crispy char, and (cue the fan fare) acidulated ( you need to put fresh ones in water with lemon juice or they turn brown. Like avocado's for guac.)   I have been to nice Italian restaurants and have not seen this level of care and proper prep.    The boyfriend said that the calamari was tender and delicious.  (I'll take his word for it.)  The Divalo sauce had bite he said, but would not clean your sinuses.  

I so cannot wait until I can go back.  So good!

I am a vegetarian and it is hard to find a place that caters to my tastes and does it well.  This place does it in spades!  My boyfriend eats meat so he can enjoy it as well.  I LOVE the hummus and the Ali Baba Pitza!  We go here for birthdays, New Years, and just because.  

I have seen kids here, but there is no kids menu, so be sure your kids will eat anything.  

The deserts are killer!

I dream about this place.  I wish they were open later in the day, but that is what makes it special.  Never had a bad meal yet and the decaf coffee is just as fresh and hot as the regular, which is something I don't see very often outside of a coffee shop.
The boyfriend and I ate here last year and want to go back but due to the  cash only policy, we forget about the place often , which is a shame.  Good food and you get more than you pay for.

I had the pleasure of winning tickets to the Browns -Packers pre-season game for 8/13/11 via the county library summer reading program.  I was a part of a group of winners who also were the American Flag bearers (40 yard flag) during the national anthem.

This was my first pro game ever and I know pre-season is not as hectic as regular, but the staff at the stadium is top notch!  I am a larger woman and normally I can do well on my own.but due a knee injury from exercise, I was having trouble walking.  Right after our on field practice, they staff was right there with a chair and water for me and again right after the on field program.  The stadium staff was also most accommodating, including getting me a wheelchair to take me out of the stadium when I was ready to leave since my knee said "NO!" when I tried to walk.    I say that this made my whole experience even better knowing that guest services are top of the top notch.

If you need a chair and are going to the game, call ahead and they will meet you at the gate with one.

I used to love the Westlake store and would have given them a good review.  In recent events, I am helping the best friend with her upcoming wedding and we are doing her florals in silk.  Westake's selection is pitiful and hard to peruse compared to this location.  Pat Catans, I do agree, seems to be getting away from the DYI craft supplies and more to the already done for you.  I love to work with the wood boxes and the paper mache products and this store has much more to choose from than the other one near me.
It's good, but a little pricey for a "let's just go out" place.  Average Italian and decor, some stuff under $10,  most under $15.

It's Chipotle.  I don't need to say anything except pass the hot sauce.

O.K. love the bowls and I like that I can get it with just rice, cheese and sour cream with hot on the side.  Love the chips.

Boyfriend loves the place and took me along.  I'm not too crazy for Mexican (too many peppers for me, like it spicy, but don't like peppers) but I am in love with this place.

I am not a fan of chain ethnic foods, especially Italian, which is royally easy to screw up.  That said, why did I eat here?  Well I have been drug here for birthdays and such over  the years and the boyfriend and I just ate here this weekend out of desperation.  (I.e. no food since breakfast and it was going on 7 p.m.)

We had to wait 20 min. which went by fast.  Our service was outstanding which is something this location usually does well.  We both had the stuffed rigatoni with chicken.  My meal was typical.  Find the chicken (so did NOT look like the picture on the menu) and the pasta was woefully over cooked.  

It's Olive Garden, so......

I finally got a chance to go here,even though I live with in walking distance, I still had to make time to stop.  The owner was very nice and really funny.   I did see what other reviewers meant about the toys, but I felt they were whimsical, but perhaps they have read the reviews here and have toned it down.  I bake myself,even though I specialize in cookies, I will make the occasional pie or cake.   I love to find a bakery that's better than me and I love to support local businesses when I can.  

That said, I got one chocolate cherry and one lemon cupcake.  I agree with another reviewer that the containers are really great and that they do indeed keep your cupcake stable, so big kudos to the owners for thinking ahead on that one!

The cherry cupcake was really moist, full of cherries and the ganache  was a happy blend of chocolate pudding and fudge.  It was so close to my award winning chocolate covered cherry bread  (2nd place in the 2010 Cuyahoga County Fair) that I was impressed. 

The lemon cake needs some work, however.  The cake itself was a little dry (could have been that individual cake) and again, I must agree with a fellow reviewer that the frosting needs some work.  While did not find ti overly sweet, I did find it crunchy, and frosting should not be crunchy, so they need to work on that.  The lemon curd that was hiding under the frosting appeared to homemade as it was NOT a lurid yellow color and more in line with the filling of a homemade lemon meringue pie, which is a VERY good thing.  

All in all this a very nice shop and they plan on adding tables as soon as the weathers warms.  I will return and see what else they offer and I will re-review if needed.

I have been here in the past and it has been MUCH better than this,  It has been while and I am not crazy about chain Italian food, but this is so much better than Olive Garden.  That said, we were out on 3/8 for my b-day and I chose this place because was easy to get my 94 year old grandma in and out of , the food appeals to all the people involved and price wise not too bad.  

We were seated with speed and as we were sitting down, the table to our right was finishing up.  They left and their table went un-bused the ENTIRE time we were there, and it was bothersome as some of our party had to look at it the entire meal.  Wine glasses, butter, bread, dishes.  The whole shebang.  Gross.  I couldn't get what I really wanted as they changed the menu, so what I got was fine.  It was supposed to have a lemon butter sauce that had no lemon whatsoever in it.  I am lemon freak but even the boyfriend couldn't find it, so is was not just me.  Our waitress vanished when I needed to rethink my order and said that it would be  a minute, it was more like 10.  Our orders were not as hot as they should have been and my dish came with artichokes that were either raw or cooked right.  They still had a an inedible membrane attached to the outer layer, so that was unpleasant and not excusable on the kitchens part  Waitress redeemed herself with the cheese ( I LOVE cheese, chocolate and lemons.)   And I got a very nice chocolate cake type desert on the house for the b-day.

All in all, not impressed and reluctant to go back to at least this location for a while.

I am a HUGE Browns fan and when I heard that Al "Bubba" Baker had a place, I HAD to go.  I was and am not let down every time I make the trip to Avon.  Full of sports memorabilia and several screens to watch whatever sports event is going on, it is so worth it.  My mom and grandma love the St. Louis ribs and my boyfriend is working his was through all of them.  Me, I go for the mac and cheese.  THE BEST MAC AND CHEESE   I HAVE HAD SO FAR!  I love the fried chicken too.  You can only get half or whole, and I swear they are Dolly Parton chickens!   The breasts are that big.  The deserts are killer too.

Bubba himself works here and will seat, cook, greet, and bus tables , which to me says a lot to this place and that  is that he is not just a name on the door.

They also do catering.  If I ever need a caterer, I'm going with them.

2-20-11 Update:

Not too happy with the place as of the date listed above.  We went  on the 20th to celebrate the boyfriends b-day and it was NOT a 5 star experience!  It was more like a 3, which is NOT normal for the place.  They were out of St. Louis ribs (they were in the smoker), there were no cornbread mini muffins (which it is worth going just for those) and they were out of both Sierra Mist and lemonade, which I find a little hard to believe.  Service left a lot to be desired, and yes they were busy, but I have been there when it has been slammed and had better service.  My mom had the fried chicken and her thigh was under cooked.  My grilled breast was a little dry, but the boyfriend said that his sliders were really good and grandma said the baby backs were very meaty.

A sign was posted looking for experienced help, so that may have been part of the problem.

Will this keep me from going back, no.  Every one has an off day.  If it keeps happening, yes I will stop going.

I have been going here for years.  The prices have gone up a bit over the years, but the quality and quantity have not changed.  I love the turkey reuben , which like all their sandwiches, violates the "never eat anything bigger than your head" rule.  Breakfast is good too.  You need to get there  in the late afternoon or early evening.   After 5 is insane!  You will have to wait, but it is worth it.  Excellent mac and cheese (Fridays in Lent) and it sells out quickly!

Clean.  New. Modern decor Vietnamese restaurant that serves from pho to egg noodles to your favorite grill on the table wraps. Haven't tried the BBQ grill on the table yet although it looks and smells wonderful - but have tried their egg noodles dry version, BBQ beef and pork rice dishes, lemon grass vermicelli, shrimp paste and pork patties vermicelli, pho and Bun Bo Hue noodle soup. The egg noodles dry version is pretty legit. It's not overlooked and has the perfect texture what a good bowl of egg noodles should be. The soup that comes on the side is on the salty side and doesn't have much flavor of a pork broth. The vermicelli and rice plates are good too. The pho is so-so, I only ordered it for my kids since they love pho. The Bun Bo Hue was a disappointment. Noodles were way over cooked, soup doesn't have much lemon grass flavor and it has too much meat going on in there from tendons to pigs skins to pieces of slices of beef shanks and meat patties like. The pork blood wasn't fresh - has a stinky smell to it and there weren't enough Vietnamese herbs and vegetables that should come with this noodle dish on the side. Let's just say, i would not order this again. Will I be back? For sure for their egg noodles and maybe try out their BBQ grill on the table the next time we are in town.

After reading all of the 4 & 5 star reviews my wife & I were excited to visit this new breakfast eatery after my doctor's appointment at Mayo. Sad to say, the dining experience fell far short of 3 stars, much to say, anything more. My cheddar cheese, spinach & mushroom omelette was underwhelming, to say the least. It was dehydrated & tasteless. The hashbrowns appeared to have just emerged frozen from a box & to add insult to injury they were cold. On a somewhat positive note, our server did replace them graciously - not that they were any better, but at least, not cold. 

Perhaps we caught them on a bad day; if so, too bad, cause my first visit was my last.

Best place to dine!
Service five stars!
Food five stars!
Atmosphere five stars!
Cleanliness five stars!
Price five stars! 
Long line to get in, but I was VIP and they made me feel like a VIP!

This place was AHHHHHhhhmazing! We started with the jalapeño poppers and I split the Soba noodle chicken salad with my date. The poppers were a little hot for her and I wasn't too found of the sauce. Just the poppers by themselves were awesome. The Soba noodle chicken salad was excellent.  I loved the atmosphere and the cubbies were winning. We decided to finish watching the game and ordered one of the gourmet burgers and dawgs. The food just got better and better.  Along with the awesome drinks we became stuffed, but wanted to try more. The push up pops were small enough to give into temptation and they were very good.

We ate here on our second of five days in Vegas. No other place met the expectations of BurGR. BurGR motivated us to try all of Gordon's places (in Vegas), but they did not equal the experience. I regret not coming here a second or third time before leaving. My next visit here I plan on trying every item on the menu over the stay.

Maybe I'm giving the poor review because I went to BurGR the night before and had such a great dining experience. Food and service were mediocre. After eating at BurGR I was motivated to try all of Gordon's pubs. Disappointed. Appetizers were good.

We had a great experience at Hanny's!  The food was excellent and service was very good. The exception was our waiter failed to pour wine after he delivered the bottle. Great pizza, better than a 3 rating!

Jimmy a is by far the best breakfast diner in Lake county.  Staff is beyond friendly, very attentive also.  Food is too notch and looks amazing.  We eat there at least once a week.  To top it of the prices are incredibly fair.

Cute place, good location.  Food is mediocre and slightly over priced.  $1.29 for cheese on an already $8 omelet is excessive.  Even then it's a slice of American cheese layer on top.  Gets the job done but nothing impressive.

Bonne soirée lounge au Salon Daomé. Petit club à l'étage, pas très grand mais pas du tout blindé pour autant (et c'est toujours comme ça d'après un ami). Ce qui dût agréable. La musique passait vraiment bien, les gens et le personnel étaient sympathiques. Les boissons étaient peut être un peu cher par contre, même si c'est inhérent à ce genre d'endroits.

Sushi à volonté rue Saint-Denis. 190 mets différents à la carte !
J'y ai très bien mangé (aka je me suis bien gavé). Tout ce que j'y ai mangé était bon voir très bon. Le service était assez rapide mais déplorable : pas un sourire, pas un mot... A lire les autres avis, cela semble "normal" ici...
Le midi, compter 22$ taxes et pourboires compris.

J'y ai mangé une bonne queue de castor (ma première donc pas d'élément de comparaison). Les autres semblaient tout aussi bonnes. 
Néanmoins, service plus que limite. Je m'y suis rendu un dimanche midi, il n'y avait personne, une seule serveuse. Aucune amabilité, aucun sourire, quelques rares mots échangés, que ce soit avec moi ou les clients qui ont suivi. Aucune réponse, si ce n'est un hochement de tête à mon "au revoir". La serveuse de faisait royalement chier et le faisait savoir !
De plus, aucun verrou dans les toilettes...

Café un peu bruyant en pleine après-midi de semaine, accueil peu chaleureux et café pas exceptionnel. Le lieu est bien situé, mais j'ai connu mieux et pense pouvoir trouver plus agréable dans le quartier.

Petit restaurant chinois à l'étage. Beaucoup de choses à la carte ; sûrement trop. J'y ai notamment mangé du porc aux légumes chinois : très bon mais un peu simpliste, manquait peut être d'un peu de riz en accompagnement. Accueil peu chaleureux.

Le baristas sont sympathiques et accueillants. Plusieurs cafés à la carte : juste ce qu'il faut ! Mon "régulier" était relevé et bon. Le pain aux raison qui l'a accompagné excellent !
Musique lounge et café assez calme (pas mal de gens y travaillaient).

I got my wedding cake here in 2004, and have been back many times. At the time it was my favorite bakery in Pittsburgh, but that's no longer the case. Perhaps their quality has declined as they've gotten bigger? Their products are good but hardly the best in Pittsburgh. The cakes and cookies all taste very similar, like they all came from the same base mix (sweet but bland), and they always seem a little undone, like they needed a few more minutes in the oven. The cake frosting is sweet but lacks the creamy richness of real buttercream. The doughsants (croissant-donut hybrids) are heavy. The fruit fillings in the danish taste artificial. I like their hot pepper bagels a lot, but that's the only real standout in my mind.

On the plus side, it's a very production-oriented place so they rarely run out of things. If I needed to pick up a coffee cake or cookie tray, I'd go here instead of Giant Eagle. But I'll go to Vanilla in Regent Square for cupcakes, and La Gourmandine in Lawrenceville for croissants. And definitely somewhere else if I ever need another wedding cake.
This place is awesome really took care of me even thought I'm kind of picky go here thank you I can't wait to munch this

Kayla gave us great customer service she made my experience extra and enjoyable... the food was so so good, nachos cheese and jalapeño was simple but had a unforgettable taste definitely coming back before I leave vegas !!!

Went for a meal and to watch a hockey game. Had the bangers and mash - the side of beans tasted like they came from a can and the kale was very literally three pieces of plain kale. The sausages and mash potatoes were good. 

A staff did change the tv away from a tied hockey game with 5 min remaining in the third. 

Overall, a poor experience which was only saved by a good beer recommendation.

Albert came out after calling about a leaking toilet. While he was here we had him look at a bath tub faucet that would gush water after pulling up the leaver to make the shower work. He was able to reset the toilet (it needed a wax ring) and also fix the faucet. No gushing water! Albert was professional, courteous and efficient. If we ever need a plumber, will definitely call A+ and ask for Albert!  Thanks

Enjoyed five laps Porch 911 plus 5 laps Ferrari F430 Scuderia x 2. My instructor JT was outstandingly professional. Yes, I had driven a paddle shifting supercar before but never like this. Flawless experience. Rare combo of excitement plus learning something. This business is running in top form. Bravo! Bravo!

this sonic location sucks! its the slowest location ive ever been too in clark county! well come to think of it, slowest location ive been too anywhere! i couldn't believe how long the drive-thru wait was. at least 20 minutes for a dam slush! at least 12 cars in line----all honking their horn! it made me late to an appointment. management better start stepping in & pay full attention to what the hell is going on. looks like this location hasn't received a good review in ages. 

warning: do not go to this location!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I've been to this location many times. This store always seems to be stocked with everything except what I initially went in for. Yesterday I was looking for Bedding. Of course I was reaching desperate measures being that I walked into every tom, dick & harry prior to swinging through their doors. I remembered that they did carry bedding supplies at this location as they do not have a bedding dept at the NLV location (so that's a plus). With that being said I still didn't find anything ugh!! This location does have a good selection of purses, shoes, jewelry and other accessories. Stores apparel caters to the "Carol Bradys" so be prepared if your under 40 stay the f### out! Nevertheless the womans clothing department looks like a huge RAINBOW! I as always seem to find a Lil something before I hit the door. Prices are Fair comparable to Ross or Tjmaxx. Sometimes they'll have an extra 15% off red tags. Parking is good, always open spaces infront. Happy Shopping!!

Its McDonald's! Depends on the timing when you go to this location & the staff that is working that shift. Ive had messed up orders one day & extremely quick service the next. I usually go through Drive-thru being that I'm on the go most of the time. There is usually a wait but not too bad. Both cashiers are usually opened. Check your bag before you leave or you'll have a hell of a time straightening out your order & you will have to walk in. There is a lot of trainees at this location. I never see the same face twice! The food is never cold, but I usually just order a French Fry & Sweet Tea. Cant beat the $1 drinks! Inside isn't the cleanest Ive been to better. There is a lot of traffic especially kids being that there are so many schools in the area. Its a newer location so I wish they would keep up the maintenance a bit better (both inside & out) before everything gets thrashed. Of course I'd go back out of convenience.

I have nothing but positive things to say about this dealership. I had an awesome sales guy named "El". He was helpful in every aspect. No hard core sales, he worked the numbers & made everything right. Drove off with the exact car I wanted. I didn't have to compromise at all & got a payment I was totally satisfied with. Service Department has been great also. I love my car & get compliments just about everyday. THANKS GUYS!!!

If you really want to test a restaurant, go eat there as a single. A lot of high end restaurants, like Joe's seafood prime steak crab in Vegas, don't like single tables and they treat you like crap. Not at The Capital Grille!  They treated me like I was a VIP. Excellent service from Mike Sabini who gave me his card to request him next time. Who knew you could do that?  Anyway, got a nice table with a view of the strip. The lobster bisque was very nice, good ceaser salad and the filet Oscar style was fantastic.  Although you can find a really good steak elsewhere, The Capital Grille should be in your short list!

I so wanted to like this place, as I am a foodie and love steakhouses. The reviews were very good, the restaurant was close and there was a good time available. As I was alone, I was given a small table close to the kitchen, which was understandable. However, I didn't really enjoy the constant parade of waiters brushing my shoulder every time they went by. Service from my waiter was a bit slow and he was indifferent. Whenever I try a new steakhouse, I normally order my favorite, tenderloin Oscar Style. To me this is a perfect way to see if a steakhouse is worth its' salt. With a name like Joe's Seafood, Prime Steak & Stone Crab expectations were understandably high. I ordered it medium rare. When it came, it came with crab on top and sauce on the side, it looked like a beautiful piece of meat but was disappointed when I cut into the middle of it and it was RAW, as in the top 1/4" and bottom 1/4" were cooked properly but the middle 1" looked blue. When I told my waiter that it was RAW in the middle, he started an argument with me by asking me "I thought you ordered it medium rare?", I said "I did, but this is RAW in the middle." "So you don't want it medium rare?" I said, "That isn't medium rare." "You sure?" as he made a big show of bending down and examining the steak and then giving a patronizing look. "So you would like your steak cooked medium, then?" I said "Medium rare" He eventually took my plate back to the kitchen and 20 min later came out with it again. The steak was now overcooked, the sides were cold, which means they didn't keep my plate warm, the crab was now off to the side and not on top and the béarnaise sauce was cold. I know I was a single table but I didn't deserve to be treated like crap. I'm sure most people get treated better than I but I cannot recommend this place to anybody. I've had much better food and service at the Charcoal Room at Palace Station and the Steakhouse at Circus Circus. Ceasers' deserves better.

I was blown away by the food here! I love all things potato and absolutely loved the skinny fries (with the corn dog appetizer) and I also tried the fatties with the lobster rolls and those were to die for! However, the star of the entire meal was my husband's bologna sandwich. Hands down the best sandwich I've had in a long time! This will likely be a repeat stop every time we are in Vegas!

Looking for some finely crafted cocktails? Search no further! Chez Dallaire is gem to have in the area. The level of knowledge and attention put into the service and drinks is very impressive. I was even informed that they make their own lemonade in house :) I ordered an Amoretto Sour and was given the option to have it made with or without egg whites. That was yet another sign of a place that treats cocktail making with the respect it deserves! Overall, great service, great drinks, nice atmosphere and a great place! Ps I did not try the food but I shall be returning!
I like Costco and I find the staff pretty friendly. This Costco seems to always be clean and well stocked!

Guests were evacuated from hotel after a 15 minute exploratory period to determine the cause of the emergency. Hotel concierge was rude and not accommodating and did not handle the situation in a professional manner. I would advise against staying at this property not only for safety concerns but for their lack of hospitality.

This is my regular shop, being just a 5min walk away from my flat.


 There is no set time to go to get the best availability, as it varies every day. This appears to depend on how is the manager that day, very annoying. They are also really bad at having the aisles blocked with large cages early in the evening, rather than using the smaller shopper friendly versions. I also hate having to go in on a Sunday, as if you want anything like tinned tomatoes, you will have to go on hand and knees to find an unbashed tin at the very back of the shelf.


 I have to agree on the shoplifters. I saw a guy just before New Year taking a TV from the display unit. In full view of security and the customer services desk. He was wearing a similar coloured top to the staff, but still!!


 Clothes section isn't bad, but as they don't send out leaflets like Tesco etc, and our local paper was disbanded in the budget cuts, you never know when they have offers on etc.

Have been in here three times recently. The first two times, I was using vouchers which gave two drinks and two small plates for £5 and the third was because we had enjoyed the food so much!


 The small plates were much larger than we had expected to be (especially for the £5 offer!) and are great value if you are in with a few friends. I can heartily recommend the meatballs, slow cooked duck and panko breaded chicken to name a few.


 The first time, we wandered in and sat through in the main bar on the bench seats. It can get quite noisy through here though, especially if there is a group of women screeching, but it's very bright and airy. The second and third time it was a bit busier, so we were sat by a maitre'd in the small alcoves near the door and then in one of the side rooms. Again, both of these areas are bright and airy, but the alcoves don't really fit more than 3 people.

Unless you like heavily salted food, I wouldn't bother. How this place is rated so highly through TripAdvisor, I'll never know!


 I had the Mushroom Wellington and a cup of tea. I received a small plate that was half "hand cut" chips and the other half was a pathetic bit of Iceberg lettuce with one slice of tomato, with a small tub of homemade coleslaw. The Wellington had been chucked on top of this, so as you can imagine, not the best presentation.


 It took 8 or 9 mouthfuls of stodgy, salty, pastry to get to any sort of "filling" in the Wellington. Yes, as advertised, there was a mushroom, spinach and cheese filling, unfortunately, there was absolutely no taste to any of it. The "hand cut" chips, come heavily salted. So heavily, that you think they must have been salted before going into the fryer! The only thing on the plate that was halfway decent was the coleslaw.


 Service was decent, when they weren't busy sprawled across the booths chatting to their mates. Tables were also far too cramped, both for getting into and the number of people expected to sit around them. Oh and you get two Fruit Salad chewy sweets with your bill.


 It's fair to say that I won't be going back.

I would have liked to review Spoon, but unfortunately, they sat me down with a menu and then proceeded to ignore me. After failing to attract anyone's attention, I left after 15mins. I could have understood the wait if they were busy, but there were about 8 people in who had clearly already been served.

I had a brilliant time at the Qype event that was held here last week. 4 excellent cheeses (Anster mature cheddar, Loch Arthur mature cheddar, Inverloch goats cheese and Isle of Kintyre Applewood) were served up with some lemon infused rapeseed oil, three home-made chutneys and some Stewart Brewing beer (Hollyrood, Edinburgh Gold, Embra and St Giles), all held together by a very lovely and knowledgeable owner and one of the brewers from Stewarts. I'm not a beer or lager drinker, but I did really enjoy the pairing of them with cheese and it's something that I might try again at home.
This was a really lovely shop, which I hope to be back in shortly, that has a great selection of produce. I especially enjoyed the spiced pumpkin chutney, which I may be misappropriating as having been made by me in this year's Christmas hampers!!

Excellent, reasonably priced, French restaurant in Haymarket. Also do an excellent line in outside catering. Have taken lots of family and friends here, and no one has a bad word to say about it. I have a 9 year old niece who asks to be taken here for lunch, every time she visits!!

Everything about Peter's Yard is excellent. Except the toilets. You have two, so please make one male and one female!! Sent my mum & dad here for a chocolate tasting night as a mother's day present. Was only £5 each and her and my dad were in there for about 3 hours. They absolutely loved it, and couldn't wait to go back.


 You have to try the lemon bread, using mascarpone instead of butter, as it's gorgeous. Also, the fig bread is out of this world.


 They also now have ice cream in for the summer, so another trip may be in order!

I have only been here once and that is a crime. I do live on the other side of town, but there is a bus which takes me right there, so I really have no excuse!
I had the pulled pork when I was in and it was outstanding! The staff are very helpful and will point you in the right direction heat wise for the salsa's. I was lucky enough to be able to get a seat, but there are lliterally only a handful, so you have to time it right! They also have a loyalty card, which must be great for the people who live near. (can you hear the pang of regret at living just that bit too far away?)
My only complaint is that they don't deliver to my side of town yet. I can live in hope though

Was in here for the first time last night and am going back tonight!


 I had egg noodles with duck, brocolli and mixed peppers in black bean sauce. The black bean sauce was thick with black beans, which you don't find often here, and the duck was just melt in the mouth. I also love the fact they don't feel the need to charge extra for king prawn or duck.


 I can see me spending far too much time in here during the Fringe and beyond!!

This is a really small restaurant on Rose Street, so fills up quickly. Great staff who will explain the menu to you if you are finding it difficult to choose or need to know what something is.


 We got a great deal for this place on 5pm.co.uk. £12 for a glass of wine, miso soup, starter, main course with side salad and green tea. Even without this deal, it's well priced (especially the sushi - two pieces of sushi for £1.50 and £3.50 for the 6 piece rolls).


 All of the food was excellent. The miso soup was unlike any I'd had before, the pork gyoza were full of full flavour, as were the chicken yakitori. I had ramen noodles with spring greens as my main course and it was just lovely. My friend had the tuna rolls and said they were gorgeous, with beautifully fresh tuna.


 Were now trying to work out reasons to be in Rose Street when we don't live or work near that end of town!! They also do take away, so looking forward to trying that.

Popped into Port and Fi with my parents for a quick bite to eat on a Wednesday evening. We were enroute to an event that had a buffet, but wanted to make sure we weren't left hungry in case it was a bit sparse.


 As such, we eat from the light bites and starters section of the menu. Dad had the fishcakes with homemade tartar sauce. No idea what they tasted like as he they were apparently so good they vanished in record time!!! Mother had the ciabatta with chicken breast and chilli jam. This was excellent and came with a huge salad and gorgeous home made coleslaw. I went for the veggie option of this with halloumi and dill and lemon mayo (some of the nicest mayo I've tasted!).


 It was fairly busy when we were in with several tables of people eating and a couple just in for coffees. No wonder, the coffee is lovely! Just beware the Danesi cups though, as they are quite heavy.


 All 3 of us will be back. We just couldn't believe it had taken us so long to get there in the first place!!

I have been in this Wannaburger twice, but that was definately once too often!!


 The first time, my friend and I went in there with an offer we had and everything was fine. We had a limited choice of burger due to the offer, but that wasn't a problem for us.


 Unfortunately, the second time we went in was on the spur of the moment after a meeting when we were ravenous. The menu had been changed and the options were no longer the same. My friend had the blue cheese burger and I had, what I was lead to believe, was a jalapeno chilli burger. Unfortunately, what I got was chilli, which I am really can't stand. As it was on top of the burger, it was easy to wipe off and I started to eat the plain burger. That was until I came across something in the burger. I was later told that it was a piece of the greaseproof paper that they use to sit the burgers on in the chiller/freezer. The original member of staff wan't overly helpful about it, but did get the manager who apologised and took the cost of the burger off the bill. Despite this, the bill still came to just under £20 for two burgers, fries and drinks. What a rip off!!


 This is not somewhere that I will be heading back to in the future.

Came her for lunch on Saturday and will definately be back.


 There were three of us and we started with the antipasti sharing plate. (while we were waiting for this, we were given a tasting plate of 24 month aged parmesan with balsamic creme) This sharing plate came with white pork mortadella, spicy salami, chicken terrine parfait, pecorino cheese, gorganzola, sourdough bread, pickled veg and San Danielle ham. All of these were totally outstanding and clearly the top of the range. Luckily, we took this for two people as there was so much of it! We followed this up with one of us having the meatballs in tomato sugo and the other two having the baked aubergine. Unfortunatley, we were all too stuffed to have dessert, but their coffee was outstanding. Bei and Nanini doesn't taste like that anywhere else in town!


 If you're the driver and are in here for the night, try the "red bitter". It's Campari without the alchol and makes a refreshing change for drinking coke all night.

I have been going to Sadivino since they first opened. It was originally a licensed grocery store with one or two tables. When it changed hands, they changed the focus to sit in and take away food. The d'vine salad is to die for, and the soups are out of this world. One thing - don't expect your panini to come out squashed flat and roasting hot. This doesn't happen in Europe, so expect beautifully toasted bread and your fillings lightly warmed through.

Was here 10 days ago with my mother after a spa. It was very, very quiet for a Friday lunchtime (we were one of two tables occupied) which led to little atmosphere.


 To start, I had the cob chowder, but don't remember what mother had. For mains, I had the harissa chicken and mother had the aubergine tian. The food and drink were both nice enough, but there was something missing. I don't know if it was a lack of atmosphere, but it was enough that we won't be rushing back.

I have been visiting Falko since he opened and have not been disappointed. Carrot cake, baked cheesecake, poppyseed cheesecake, you name it, he makes it, and it's gorgeous!


 Falko makes challah bread, especially for the Jewish community, that can be bought on a Thursday or Friday (if you're quick!), and it is worth the trip.


 Also, the cheese tongues are one of the best things ever.


 *EDIT* Ended up here for lunch on Saturday (after disappointing effort at Monteiths), and it did not disappoint! We had the goats cheese and red pepper sandwich plate. Basically, you are given a bread basket and your sandwich plate of choice and left to get on with it! Get in early though, as trying to get a seat can be murder.

This place is excellent! I took my dad for Father's day last year and he loved it.


 Beware the plastic seats in the summer though, as people have been known to stick to them!


 Also, beware of being ripped off if they are running the food in the Pleasance Dome in Bristo Square during the Fringe again this year though. They more than doubled their prices, and got away with it, as people didn't know the actual MK was just across the road!

I went here with a friend one night. She really enjoyed it, but I didn't. I didn't feel that the fish was quite right (although not in a way that made us ill). I also didn't appreciate the waitress constantly coughing.
There menu is badly laid out and worded, as they have a double sided card that shows some set menus and bento boxes. There are two types of bento box, and the wording beside one states it's for lunch only, but this actually applies to them both and needs to be clearer.
There was a man collecting a take away order while we were in and he had to come back into the restuarant 3 or 4 times to collect the missing pieces!
I have been back since by myself, but no, this place isn't for me.

Basically, the best place to eat on the west side of town. Don't let the journey put you off (it is the far end of Gorgie Road, along by McDonalds), as it is worth every minute you have to wait in the tram roadworks.


 The pork collops in thyme and lemon sauce with cucumber in sour cream salad and potato dumplings and pork crackling (really pancetta) is to die for! It costs less than £6!! They have gorgeous soup, ciabbatta. side dishes, salads, desserts. You will not go wrong if you eat here. Expect t have a 20min approx wait, as everything is cooked to order.


 This is a really small cafe, that can only seat 6 people. Don't worry if you can't get in, as they do take away as well (although not delivery).

This place has been queued out of the door everytime I've been in, so I've not had the chance to sit in yet.


 I think it's fair to say that these guys do the best wraps in Edinburgh!! Falafel and fuul is a particular favourite.

One of the best nights out in Edinburgh! Get in early if you want a seat though, but beware, if you do get in as soon as the doors open you may have a couple of hours before the show starts. Therefore, if it's the weekend, kill some time with the excellent food they serve. There is nothing fancy about the food, but you can tell that time and effort has gone into making it. Totally agree about the nachos, and the chicken wrap goes down well also.

Average Mexican restaurant in the old Pizza Hut on Lothian Road.


 I have been twice now, once with a friend and once on my own. Both times have been alright, but absolutely nothing to write home about.


 The first time, with my friend, I had the chicken burrito while she had the chicken quesadilla. She enjoyed her quesadilla, but admitted she didn't know how authentic it was as she hadn't tried one before. My burrito was alright. I had the pinto beans the hot salsa and paid the extra for guacamole, sour cream and jalapenos. Despite this, I found it to be very dry, there was no taste on the chicken from the marinade, the hot salsa had no heat and the jalapenos were underwhelming to say the least.


 I went back a second time, a few weeks later, to give the place a second chance. I ordered the same thing again in case I had just been in at a bad time before, but unfortunately it was even drier this time due to the fact that I didn't get the sour cream I'd asked, and been charged, for. I didn't realise this until later on, so it wasn't brought up with the staff at the time.


 Now don't get me wrong, there is nothing bad about the food there at all. It's just underwhelming. To me, the marinade does nothing to the chicken, the salsa and jalapenos are both marked as hot when they are nothing of the kind and there is no where near enough moisture in the burrito.


 I fully accept that this is down to my own personal tastes, but if I am to go back, it will purely be for convenience and nothing else.


 There's far too much hype put out about this place and you really shouldn't believe it all.

Lovely wee pub at Haymarket, that always seems busy.


 There is a basement bar as well, that features comedy every Thursday as well as other regular nights.


 Only eaten in here a couple of times, but the tempura prawns are lovely!!

I've been to Zucca twice now. Once for Saturday lunch with the folks and once with mate for the pre-theatre. Neither has disappointed!


 The food has been wonderful and fresh, the service was on the right side of attentive and it's not stupidly priced.


 I would say that the table immediately to the right of the waiters station is not best placed, as we felt slightly in the way and that the waiters werent sure who was dealing with us.


 We have another night at the theatre in February, so are looking forward to trying the food downstairs this time!

Was recently in the Traverse, for the first time in years, to watch "a play, a pie and a pint". This concept has been running for years in oran Mor in Glasgow, and is now finally showing in Edinburgh as well.


 Everything about it was really well done. Lovely drinks, lovely pies, great play and all done and dusted in just under an hour!


 I'm looking forward to the next "a play, a pie and a pint" season and the Noisy Nights they are now running as well, which sound quite interesting.


 EDIT: 30 July 2010


 Made the mistake of ordering spicy salsa nachos in the cafe bar last night.


 A bowl rammed full of cardboardy nachos, a piece of bland melted cheese on one nacho and a ladleful of a slightly powdery tasting, cold, spicy salsa does not a bowl of nachos make!!! There was also 2 small dishes of soured cream and guacamole, which both tasted of nothing.


 Come on Traverse! There was once a time when your nachos were famed across town. What happened??

This is an alright bar with a decent soundtrack (assuming your into heavy metal, goth rock etc etc). They have now started a B Movie night on Mondays which is excellent. Adam the manager. has the most obscure film library! If there's a particular film you want to see, just ask as chances are has it or knows where to find it.


 I'm usually in for the comedy on a Thursday, and while the Crypt isn't the warmest room, it's usually an alright night of local comedy.


 Can't say I think much of the food though..

Had lunch here on Saturday and really wish I hadn't.


 Monteiths gets a good write up in the List Eating Guide, and has a lovely entrance. That's it.


 When we went in there were a 3 or 4 Leinster fans having a an early lunch before the match. We heard them long before we saw them, but soon realised that was due to the volume of the music which was more suited to a bar at midnight and not a Saturday lunch.


 We were just left standing for a few minutes while they checked if our table was ready, and seemed to be in the way of the staff. We were then seated towards the back of the bar (with a draft coming from the open door leading out to the small courtyard). We did ask for the music to be turned down, and it was, but not for long.


 As we had been unable to see the lunch menu on the street, there was little on the starter menu that appealed, so we just went straight for the main course. We were served 3 micro portions of food that wouldn't have filled up a small child. There were no vegetables served with the meal, and no options on the menu to even pay for a side option. The food seemed nice enough, but unfortunately it was hard to tell due to the smallness of portion.


 Overall this was a thouroughly disappointing Saturday lunch. Especially when the bill came to just under £40 for a £7.95 per head one course lunch! £5.50 for a small glass of house wine is a bit much by anyone's standards!! We will not be back.

Definately the best for freshly made sandwiches, baked potatoes, toasties, salad boxes, wraps and specials in the area! There is something for everyone on the menu, so you won't be disappointed (unless the students have arrived before you and cleaned them out)!

Went here on Saturday, with a veggie friend who was up from London. This was a really nice, friendly restaurant, immediately next door to Chez Pierre, in the old Ducks at Le Marche Noir.


 We had the special lunch (£9.50 for 2 courses, £11.50 for 3), which consisted of 3 options for the starter and main courses and 2 options for the dessert course.


 I had the baked Roqefort with pumpkin brioche and my friend had the baked egg and vegetable terrine, both went down well. We then moved onto the the chickpea & sweet potato stew in a hollowed out marrow bowl. This was really good, although we did get a few strange looks for eating the marrow!! We then decided to pig out and have the cheese board (£3 supplement). this came with a small apple salad, grapes, 2 oatcakes (3 would have been better), quince paste and a fruit puree thing. I felt that this was let down by having 2 very strong blue cheeses and 1 very strong white cheese with a piece of emmental. It's not everyone who likes strong, or blue, cheese and I felt that there should have been more of a selection.


 We also had bread & butter and a side dish of veg, but unfortunately, you have to pay for these (why?) £1 for the bread and £2.50 for the veg, which were slightly over steamed.


 Including the cheese supplement and drinks, the bill came to £36, which really wasn't bad for what we had. I would definately go back, but maybe wait the extra 15mins for the baked fig dessert next time!

Had a brilliant meal in Pickled Green last night.


 We were sat upstairs in the main area, which to be fair is a bit sparse. It's almost as if you are eating in the shop floor area of Ikea, but please do not let this put you off!!


 My friend and I both had the wood pigeon to start. This came medium-rare and with a nettle and toasted hazelnut salad. I then opted for the sea bream, prawn dumpling and miso broth (excellent and brimming with pak choi, trumpet mushrooms and loads of other goodies!) while my friend went for the salmon with turned potatoes and sorrel butter sauce (I was reliably informed that it was wonderful). Deciding to be pigs, I then went for the chocolate and peanut butter delight (this was a terrine with chopped peanuts on top and just melted off the spoon) while my friend went for the rosemary creme brulee (brilliantly crunchy top and really good strong taste of rosemary).


 Beware the lack of lights when walking upstairs, and the music is a bit loud (but good acoustics mean you don't have to shout over it!), but please don't let them put you off.

I have been going here for about two years now, after my previous hairdresser of 16 years completely killed any trust we had after ruining my first ever cropped hair cut. It was recommended by a friend of a friend and all three of us now get out hair cut here.
Greig has been styling my hair for about the last year now and he did my first colour (in this salon) on my last visit. I was really pleased with the colour and couldn't believe how well priced it was.
It's a really friendly, welcoming salon and I hope to be going here for many years to come.

Caciopepe is the latest incarnation of the old Patio Restaurant and definately the best!


 I have eaten here 3 times (twice at night and one at lunchtime) in the last fortnight and each time has been outstanding. The pasta is excellent (especially the butternut squash tortellini), and the people I have been dining with have all had rave reviews of the pizzas, lasagne and scallop risotto. They also do a lovely Prosecco by the glass.


 This is somewhere I plan to use frequently and I hope that the standard doesn't slip once they have been open a while.
Always get the Lodge cheese steak sandwich wich is good but very unconsistent lately, bartenders can be more friendly.

Worst service ever, estevan, took forever to come to our table, we had to look for him everywhere, seriously our empty plates were sitting on our table for 45 minutes, we had to ask someone else to pick them up, we paid for the unlimited alcohol drinks which is $18 per person, and he only showed up once in two hours, so guess what? I only had 2 beers because our server only showed up one time after bringing the first beer. I am so dissapointed, food is good but service is super bad, and when you get a bad service, it is more likely that you never go back to a place. I am a server and I know this is not a fine dining place but honestly, I was expecting much more from this buffet at the Caesars Palace Hotel in Las Vegas.

I feel sorry for giving a star only. We've been coming here for 3 years and just two nights ago, our server aaron or erin was a little distracted but besides that my wife and I we both ordered the Steak Frites... And we thought its texture wasn't right and we decided to eat the whole thing... Long story short, we got home and started to feel sick, we got a very bad food poisoning. So I don't think we'll back any soon
